original: @174b # // rgya gar skad du /🔽s'u tr'a lam ka ra a'a di shlo ka s+ya dva ya s+ya by'a khy'a na /
analyzed: @174b # // rgya gar skad du / s'u tr'a lam ka ra a'a di shlo ka s+ya dva ya s+ya by'a khy'a na /
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Sūtrālaṃkāra-ādhiślokasya dvayāvyākhyāna🔽

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:🔽Sūtrālaṃkāra-ādya-ślokasya dvayasyāṭīkā.

original: mdo sde rgyan gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang po gnyis kyi bshad pa /
analyzed: mdo sde rgyan gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang po gnyis kyi bshad pa /
translated: In Tibetan:🔽mDo sde rgyan gyi tshigs su bcad pa dang po gnyis kyi bshad pa.

original: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī, the youthful one.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa thugs rje chen pos gnon pa'i thugs kyis 'gro ba sna tshogs thugs kyis gzung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa gang la
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa thugs rje chen pos gnon pa'i thugs kyis 'gro ba sna tshogs thugs kyis gzung ba'i dbang du mdzad nas chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mdzad pa gang la
translated: The Blessed One Śākyamuni, having fully awakened to perfect complete enlightenment, out of compassion, with a mind of great mercy, taking into consideration the various beings to be guided, turned the wheel of Dharma.

original: gang gi don du ji ltar gang gis bslab par bya ba'i don bzhi la dgongs nas 'khor rnams la mchog tu zab pa'i don can gyi mdo sde mtha' yas pa ston pa la 'jug par mdzad do //
analyzed: gang gi don du ji ltar gang gis bslab par bya ba'i don bzhi la dgongs nas 'khor rnams la mchog tu zab pa'i don can gyi mdo sde mtha' yas pa ston pa la 'jug par mdzad do //
translated: With the intention of the four topics - for whom, for what purpose, how, and by what means should one train - he engaged in teaching the infinite sūtras of the most profound meaning to the retinue.

original: dus shin tu yun ring por goms par byas pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes yongs su smin pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dus shin tu yun ring por goms par byas pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes yongs su smin pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa /
translated: It is fully ripened merit and wisdom that is cultivated for a very long time.

original: de'i dus na nye ba rnams la yongs su dag pa'i rgyu nyid kyis bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du don mdzad zin na yang /
analyzed: de'i dus na nye ba rnams la yongs su dag pa'i rgyu nyid kyis bsam pa ji lta ba bzhin du don mdzad zin na yang /
translated: At that time, the Teacher, who is the cause of complete purity for those who are close, having already acted for the sake of sentient beings in accordance with their thoughts,

original: ston pa 'gro ba rnams kyi mig gcig tu gyur pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na bdag cag lta bu'i gdul bya'i skye bo yongs su gzung bar bzhed nas yun ring por gnas pa'i don du gang sdud pa pos yang dag par bsdus pa yin no
analyzed: ston pa 'gro ba rnams kyi mig gcig tu gyur pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa na bdag cag lta bu'i gdul bya'i skye bo yongs su gzung bar bzhed nas yun ring por gnas pa'i don du gang sdud pa pos yang dag par bsdus pa yin no
translated: when the Teacher, who is the sole eye of the world, passes into parinirvāṇa, he wishes to take care of disciples such as us and for the sake of remaining for a long time, he is compiled by the compiler.

original: // snyigs ma lnga'i dus kyi sha zas sems can gyi tshogs kyi snying po med par gyur pa'i dus kyi tha ma de'i tshe na de'i don rtogs pa dang dka' ba nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu med par gyur pa lta bur yang dag par gzigs nas de bde blag
analyzed: // snyigs ma lnga'i dus kyi sha zas sems can gyi tshogs kyi snying po med par gyur pa'i dus kyi tha ma de'i tshe na de'i don rtogs pa dang dka' ba nyid kyi phyir 'bras bu med par gyur pa lta bur yang dag par gzigs nas de bde blag
translated: At that time, when the essence of the collection of sentient beings is destroyed by the flesh-eating beings of the age of five degenerations, at the end of that time, seeing that the meaning is realized and difficult, it is as if it becomes fruitless.

original: tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du /
analyzed: tu rtogs par bya ba'i don du /
translated: For the sake of understanding the meaning of the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras,

original: 'phags pa thogs med kyi sgo nas slob dpon dbyig gnyen la ched du gtad de /
analyzed: 'phags pa thogs med kyi sgo nas slob dpon dbyig gnyen la ched du gtad de /
translated: it was specifically entrusted to the master Vasubandhu through the noble Asanga.

original: thams cad rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir de nye bar ston pa'i bstan bcos mdo sde rgyan zhes bya ba 'di /
analyzed: thams cad rjes su gzung bar bya ba'i phyir de nye bar ston pa'i bstan bcos mdo sde rgyan zhes bya ba 'di /
translated: In order to care for everyone, this treatise that teaches that, called the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras,

original: bcom ldan 'das byams pas nye bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das byams pas nye bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: was taught by the Lord Maitreya.

original: gang la don dang ldan pa'i ming rnam par shas par bya ba'i don du tshigs su bcad pa nye bar bkod de /
analyzed: gang la don dang ldan pa'i ming rnam par shas par bya ba'i don du tshigs su bcad pa nye bar bkod de /
translated: In order to understand the meaningful names, verses were composed.

original: don dang ldan pa'i ming rnam par shes pas ni bstan bcos nyan pa po rnams kyis gus pa dang bcas pas zhes las 'jug pa'i yul du nye bar 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa'i ming rnam par shes pas ni bstan bcos nyan pa po rnams kyis gus pa dang bcas pas zhes las 'jug pa'i yul du nye bar 'gro bar byed do //
translated: By understanding the meaningful names, those who listen to the treatise will engage in the object of practice with respect.

original: 'di ltar yang 'dir don gyi rjes su 'gro bar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang 'dir don gyi rjes su 'gro bar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: In this way, one should understand that it accords with the meaning.

original: ji ltar rin po che sna @175a * //
analyzed: ji ltar rin po che sna @175a * //
translated: Just as a precious gem

original: tshogs kyi 'od 'phro ba gser gyi rang bzhin gyi gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / rna rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan gyi mchog tu gyur pa'i bud med kyi yan lag rang bzhin gyis nyams dga' bar byed pa /
analyzed: tshogs kyi 'od 'phro ba gser gyi rang bzhin gyi gdu bu dang / dpung rgyan dang / rna rgyan la sogs pa'i rgyan gyi mchog tu gyur pa'i bud med kyi yan lag rang bzhin gyis nyams dga' bar byed pa /
translated: The light of the assembly is the natural radiance of gold, the most excellent of ornaments, such as bracelets, armlets, and earrings, which naturally delight the limbs of women.

original: dpung pa'i yan lag la sogs pa mdzes par byed pa na 'jig rten la mchog tu dga' ba nye bar skyed ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: dpung pa'i yan lag la sogs pa mdzes par byed pa na 'jig rten la mchog tu dga' ba nye bar skyed ba de bzhin du /
translated: When the limbs of the arms and so on are beautified, supreme delight is generated in the world.

original: nye bar bstan pa'i bstan bcos 'dis mdo sde'i mchog tu zab pa gsal bar byed pa nyid kyis dam pa rnams la mchog tu dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'di rgyan nyid dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa'i bstan bcos 'dis mdo sde'i mchog tu zab pa gsal bar byed pa nyid kyis dam pa rnams la mchog tu dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir 'di rgyan nyid dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, this treatise, which elucidates the most profound of the supreme sūtras, generates supreme delight in the holy ones. Therefore, it is like an ornament.

original: 'o na de gang dag mdo sde'i don ji lta ba bzhin du gsal ba'i 'bras bu nye bar bstan pa la rang nyid 'jug pa la thos gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las byung ba'i shes rab dri ma med pa can phul du byung ba'i mkhas pa de
analyzed: 'o na de gang dag mdo sde'i don ji lta ba bzhin du gsal ba'i 'bras bu nye bar bstan pa la rang nyid 'jug pa la thos gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pa las byung ba'i shes rab dri ma med pa can phul du byung ba'i mkhas pa de
translated: Well then, why is it that those who are engaged in the teaching of the result that is the elucidation of the meaning of the sutras, who are endowed with stainless wisdom that has arisen from listening to the teachings from one person to another, who are the most excellent of scholars,🔽do not engage in this treatise?

original: dag bstan bcos 'di la mi 'jug pa'am /🔽'jug pa ni ci yod par 'gyur pa'am /
analyzed: dag bstan bcos 'di la mi 'jug pa'am / 'jug pa ni ci yod par 'gyur pa'am /
translated: Or, if they do engage in it,

original: yod pa'am / yod par gyur pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: yod pa'am / yod par gyur pa ma yin nam /
translated: is it not the case that they have, or will, or do engage in it?

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan gang gis na 'di nyid khyad par can gyi dga' ba bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis rgyan nyid yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsal ba'i don du phyin ci ma log pa nyid dang / mi slu ba nyid dang / don ma lus pa dag bsdus nas thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dir bstan pa yin zhes bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan gang gis na 'di nyid khyad par can gyi dga' ba bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis rgyan nyid yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsal ba'i don du phyin ci ma log pa nyid dang / mi slu ba nyid dang / don ma lus pa dag bsdus nas thun mong ma yin pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dir bstan pa yin zhes bstan pa'i don du /
translated: Therefore, in order to dispel the doubt that wonders, “For what reason is this very treatise an ornament because it is the cause that generates special joy?” and in order to teach that it is taught here as the cause that is not shared with others, having summarized all the meanings without error, without deception, and without omission,

original: don shes don ston zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: don shes don ston zhes bya ba la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: he taught “knowing the meaning, teaching the meaning,” and so on.

original: gang 'dis ni mdo sde'i don ni brgyan par bya ba nyid dang / bshad pa ni rgyan nyid dang / de'i rgyu mtshan gong du brjod pa gsum pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'dis ni mdo sde'i don ni brgyan par bya ba nyid dang / bshad pa ni rgyan nyid dang / de'i rgyu mtshan gong du brjod pa gsum pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the meaning of the scriptures is what is to be ornamented, the commentary is the very ornament, and the three reasons stated above are the reasons.

original: de la don ston zhes bya ba ni ston pa nyid kyis nye bar bstan pa'i don ni rtag tu ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pas gang yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir de dang 'brel bas khyad par dang bcas pa'i chos nye bar bstan pa'i
analyzed: de la don ston zhes bya ba ni ston pa nyid kyis nye bar bstan pa'i don ni rtag tu ltos pa dang bcas pa yin pas gang yin zhes bya ba'i dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir de dang 'brel bas khyad par dang bcas pa'i chos nye bar bstan pa'i
translated: Therein, the meaning is taught, i.e., the meaning indicated by the teaching is always dependent, hence, in order to remove the doubt as to what it is, the Dharma is indicated as qualified by that, i.e., by the meaning,

original: phyir mdo'i don kho na brgyan par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: phyir mdo'i don kho na brgyan par bya ba nyid do //
translated: because the meaning of the scriptures is what is to be ornamented.

original: mdo'i sde las gzhan pa'i chos ni mdo'i sde bzhin du theg mchog bstan pa'i rnam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mdo'i sde las gzhan pa'i chos ni mdo'i sde bzhin du theg mchog bstan pa'i rnam pa ma yin te /
translated: The Dharma which is other than the scriptural category of the sutras is not a form of teaching the universal vehicle, as is the case with the sutra category.

original: mdo'i sde kho nas shes par byas pa'i don la dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rjes su brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo'i sde kho nas shes par byas pa'i don la dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa'i sde la sogs pa rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis rjes su brjod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The other categories of the Dharma, such as the narratives, are repetitions of the meaning which is understood from the sutra category alone, by means of some other form.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For this very reason,

original: theg pa mchog bstan pa zhes brjod par bye ba yin na /
analyzed: theg pa mchog bstan pa zhes brjod par bye ba yin na /
translated: If it is a millionfold, then it is called the teaching of the supreme vehicle.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas @175b dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir 'dir bsgrub pa'i sgra lhag par brjod pa mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas @175b dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa la sogs pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir 'dir bsgrub pa'i sgra lhag par brjod pa mdzad pa yin no //
translated: The author of the treatise uses the word “establishes” here in order to exclude the possibility that it is a mere recitation.

original: de yang sgrub pas na sgrub pa zhes dngos po sgrub pa bstan pas na mi shes pa shes pa'i don khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang sgrub pas na sgrub pa zhes dngos po sgrub pa bstan pas na mi shes pa shes pa'i don khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: And since it is an establishment, it is an establishment, and since it teaches the establishment of things, it should be understood to be the meaning of the knowledge of the unknown.

original: bsgrub par bya ba yin pas bsgrub pa zhes las su sgrub pa ni shes par bya ba'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba yin pas bsgrub pa zhes las su sgrub pa ni shes par bya ba'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: Since it is to be established, it is an establishment, and since it is an establishment as an object, it is the nature of what is to be known.

original: 'dir ni las su bsgrub pa bstan par mngon par 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir ni las su bsgrub pa bstan par mngon par 'dod do //
translated: Here, it is clearly intended to be taught as an object of establishment.

original: de'i phyir don ni 'di yin te //
analyzed: de'i phyir don ni 'di yin te //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning:

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi theg pa la ltos nas khyad par can yi pa'i phyir theg mchog ste /
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi byang chub kyi theg pa la ltos nas khyad par can yi pa'i phyir theg mchog ste /
translated: In comparison to the vehicle of the śrāvaka and pratyekabuddha enlightenments, it is the supreme vehicle because it is special.

original: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin no //
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi lam yin no //
translated: It is the path to complete enlightenment.

original: de bstan pa ste bstan par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bstan pa ste bstan par shes par bya'o //
translated: It is taught, and should be known as taught.

original: sgrub pa ni sgrub pa bzhin pa ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa ni sgrub pa bzhin pa ste /
translated: The term “accomplishment” is like the term “accomplisher.”

original: rjes su gzung bar rang gis mi rtogs pa'i phyir des rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: rjes su gzung bar rang gis mi rtogs pa'i phyir des rtogs par bya ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: It is the nature of that which is to be realized by the one who does not understand the object to be realized by himself.

original: gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste de'i'o //
analyzed: gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste de'i'o //
translated: That which has it is called that.

original: dngos po sgrub pa bstan na ni bstan pa'i sgra don du rtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de 'bras bu med par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
analyzed: dngos po sgrub pa bstan na ni bstan pa'i sgra don du rtogs pa nyid yin pa'i phyir de 'bras bu med par thal ba bzlog par dka'o //
translated: If the term “accomplishment” were taught, it would be difficult to avoid the consequence that the term “teaching” would be understood as the object.

original: de bas na de ltar sgrub pa'i sgra nye bar bstan pa'i phyir 'dir khyad par du bcas pa'i chos kyi sgras mdo'i sde kho na mngon par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar sgrub pa'i sgra nye bar bstan pa'i phyir 'dir khyad par du bcas pa'i chos kyi sgras mdo'i sde kho na mngon par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to teach the term “accomplishment” in this way, the term “Dharma” is used in the sūtras, which is a special term.

original: de skad du yang 'grel pa mdzad pas chos tshol ba'i le'u las /
analyzed: de skad du yang 'grel pa mdzad pas chos tshol ba'i le'u las /
translated: Thus, in the chapter on seeking the Dharma, the author of the commentary says:

original: the tshom gyi gnyen por ni mdo sde yin te /
analyzed: the tshom gyi gnyen por ni mdo sde yin te /
translated: The sūtras are the antidote to doubt,

original: gang zhig gang la the tshom za ba de la de don nges bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la the tshom za ba de la de don nges bya ba'i phyir bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they teach in order to ascertain the meaning of that about which one has doubt.

original: yang na mdo sde ni chos kyi don bstan pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: yang na mdo sde ni chos kyi don bstan pa yin no zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Or else, the sutra collection is the teaching of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: de bas na de lta bu de nyid yin te /
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu de nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is just as we have explained.

original: gang gi phyir mkhas pa rnams ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa la sogs pa dang / gsung rab kyi rnam pa'i grangs rjod par byed pa na mdo'i sde kho na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang por gdon pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mkhas pa rnams ni mdo'i sde dang / dbyangs kyis bsnyad pa dang / lung du bstan pa la sogs pa dang / gsung rab kyi rnam pa'i grangs rjod par byed pa na mdo'i sde kho na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang por gdon pa yin no //
translated: For, when the wise recite the enumeration of the types of scriptures, such as the sutra collection, the geya, the vyakarana, etc., they recite the sutra collection first, because it is the most important.

original: de bas na mdo'i sde'i don ni brgyan par bya ba nyid du 'dir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na mdo'i sde'i don ni brgyan par bya ba nyid du 'dir brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the sutra collection is stated here as the ornament.

original: ston pa'i sgra ni bshad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir de dang de'i rjes su 'brel ba'i don ni bshad par bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: ston pa'i sgra ni bshad pa'i don yin pa'i phyir de dang de'i rjes su 'brel ba'i don ni bshad par bya ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the meaning of the sutra collection to be explained, since the word “teaching” has the meaning of explaining?

original: ji ltar na brgyan par bya ba nyid yin zhe na /🔽gal te don bshad ces bstan pa yin na bden te /
analyzed: ji ltar na brgyan par bya ba nyid yin zhe na / gal te don bshad ces bstan pa yin na bden te /
translated: How can it be an ornament?🔽If the meaning of the sutra collection is explained, that is true.

original: don ston rab tu byed pa zhes bstan pa na /
analyzed: don ston rab tu byed pa zhes bstan pa na /
translated: But when the meaning of the sutra collection is stated as a treatise,

original: sgrub bzhin pa'i bshad pa khyad par can dang @176a * //
analyzed: sgrub bzhin pa'i bshad pa khyad par can dang @176a * //
translated: The special explanation that is being accomplished.🔽🔽

original: 'brel bar khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: 'brel bar khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: One should understand that it is related to the special commentary that is being composed,

original: des mkhas pa rnams la dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des mkhas pa rnams la dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: because it generates delight in the wise.

original: brgyan par byed pa de'i yul nyid du gyur pa'i don ji ltar na brgyan par bya ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin /
analyzed: brgyan par byed pa de'i yul nyid du gyur pa'i don ji ltar na brgyan par bya ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ma yin /
translated: How can the meaning that is the very object of the ornament not be the very thing to be ornamented?

original: don 'di nyid bstan bcos mdzad pas gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe nye bar bkod pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: don 'di nyid bstan bcos mdzad pas gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas dpe nye bar bkod pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: The author of the treatise indicates just this point by the example that precedes the statement,

original: chos de 'dir bshad pa yang dga' ba'i mchog bskyed do zhes bya ba'i ngag gis ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos de 'dir bshad pa yang dga' ba'i mchog bskyed do zhes bya ba'i ngag gis ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: “This Dharma, which is taught here, generates the highest delight,”

original: de lta bas na don sten rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir don brgyan par byed pa'i don du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na don sten rab tu byed pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir don brgyan par byed pa'i don du shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, “one should rely on the meaning” should be understood here to mean “one should rely on the ornament of the meaning.”

original: de ltar na su zhig brgyan par byed /
analyzed: de ltar na su zhig brgyan par byed /
translated: In that case, who is the ornament?

original: ci zhig brgyan par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa 'grel pa mdzad pas mngon par brjod pa'i dri ba dang / lan gyi tshig rnams kyi don 'brel ba nyid du 'gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: ci zhig brgyan par byed ces bya ba la sogs pa 'grel pa mdzad pas mngon par brjod pa'i dri ba dang / lan gyi tshig rnams kyi don 'brel ba nyid du 'gyur pa yin no //
translated: The commentary explains, What is it that is adorned? and so on. The meaning of the questions and answers is related.

original: sgra ji bzhin shes pa gang dag gis dgongs pa'i don khong du ma chud na 'grel pa su zhig brgyan par byed /
analyzed: sgra ji bzhin shes pa gang dag gis dgongs pa'i don khong du ma chud na 'grel pa su zhig brgyan par byed /
translated: If those who understand the words literally do not comprehend the intended meaning, who will adorn the commentary?

original: ci zhig brgyan par byed ces bya ba'i dogs pa gnyis bsal nas /
analyzed: ci zhig brgyan par byed ces bya ba'i dogs pa gnyis bsal nas /
translated: Having dispelled the two doubts, What is it that is adorned? and What is it that adorns?

original: su zhig byed /
analyzed: su zhig byed /
translated: Who does it?

original: ci zhig byed ces gdon par rnam par brtags pa des ni /
analyzed: ci zhig byed ces gdon par rnam par brtags pa des ni /
translated: By examining the question, What is it that is adorned?

translated: Connection is the expression of a meaning in detail, just as it was expressed in brief.

original: mthun pa'i gang zag theg pa gsum dang mi 'gal bar 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: mthun pa'i gang zag theg pa gsum dang mi 'gal bar 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Appropriateness is the expression of a meaning that is suitable for a particular person.

original: rung ba ni bde ba la brten pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: rung ba ni bde ba la brten pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Suitability is the expression of a meaning that is comfortable,

original: sgra nyam nga ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra nyam nga ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sound is not harsh.

original: 'byor ba ni gang dag grags pa'i don gyis don dang ldan pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'byor ba ni gang dag grags pa'i don gyis don dang ldan pa nyid do //
translated: Readiness is the expression of a meaning that is appropriate to the world,🔽because the meaning is well known in the world.

original: 'phrod pa ni rigs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'phrod pa ni rigs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: Appropriate is that which is reasonable.

original: gdul bya dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gdul bya dang rjes su mthun pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is in accord with the disciples.

original: 'tsham pa ni gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsham pa ni gang dag mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas 'jug pa'o //
translated: Agreeable is that which is applied to nirvana.

original: 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi chogs su gyur pa ni gang dag slob pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'grus skyong gi yan lag gi chogs su gyur pa ni gang dag slob pa'i 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a collection of the limbs of exertion because it is in accord with the eightfold noble path of learners.

original: rab tu dbye ba 'di nyid /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba 'di nyid /
translated: This very analysis is taught in the following:🔽Teaching, and likewise explanation,🔽vehicle, ease,🔽fame, and as appropriate,

original: bstan dang de bzhin bshad pa dang // theg dang mthun dang bde ba dang // grags pa dang ni ci rigs dang // nges par 'byung dang mthun pa'i phyir //🔽de 'dir sems dpa' mchog rnams kyi //
analyzed: bstan dang de bzhin bshad pa dang // theg dang mthun dang bde ba dang // grags pa dang ni ci rigs dang // nges par 'byung dang mthun pa'i phyir // de 'dir sems dpa' mchog rnams kyi //
translated: liberation, and accord.🔽This is the excellence of letters

original: yi ge phun sum tshogs pa yin //
analyzed: yi ge phun sum tshogs pa yin //
translated: of the supreme heroes here.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis kyis bstan bcos mdzad pa po ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang gnyis kyis bstan bcos mdzad pa po ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: These two and a half verses teach the author of the treatise.

original: de'i phyir 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning here is this:

original: gang zhig don shes pa yin zhing de lta bu'i ngag dang / tshig rnams kyi mdo sde'i don ston pa la 'jug pa de ni ji ltar na rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i dogs pa byed /
analyzed: gang zhig don shes pa yin zhing de lta bu'i ngag dang / tshig rnams kyi mdo sde'i don ston pa la 'jug pa de ni ji ltar na rnam pa gzhan du bshad pa'i dogs pa byed /
translated: How could one who understands the meaning and who engages in teaching the meaning of the sutras in such terms as these be suspected of explaining in some other way?

original: don shes pa nyid kyis na de mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log rnams bsal ba yin par mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: don shes pa nyid kyis na de mi shes pa dang / the tshom za ba dang / phyin ci log rnams bsal ba yin par mtshon par byed do //
translated: The fact that he understands the meaning dispels the doubts and misconceptions of those who do not understand.

original: ngag dang tshig rnams dri med ces bshad pas ni /
analyzed: ngag dang tshig rnams dri med ces bshad pas ni /
translated: The explanation that his speech and terms are immaculate

original: skyon de rnams dang ldan pa nyid kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyon de rnams dang ldan pa nyid kyang rnam pa gzhan du 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: shows that he is not subject to those faults.

original: de ltar phyin ci ma log pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no //🔽don shes pa'i spobs pa dang ldan zhing /
analyzed: de ltar phyin ci ma log pa nyid bsgrubs pa yin no // don shes pa'i spobs pa dang ldan zhing /
translated: Thus, he is established as being unmistaken.🔽Even though he has the eloquence of understanding the meaning

original: gzhan khong du chud par byed pa la mkhas pa yin yang /
analyzed: gzhan khong du chud par byed pa la mkhas pa yin yang /
translated: and is skilled in causing others to understand,

original: slu bar bsams nas 'jug pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: slu bar bsams nas 'jug pa ma yin nam /
translated: is he not engaged in deceiving others?

original: gang gis na 'dir phyin ci ma log pa nyid du nges par bshad par 'gyur ba ji ltar na rnam pa gzhan du yang 'chad pa mi srid pa nyid ces bya ba'i dogs pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gis na 'dir phyin ci ma log pa nyid du nges par bshad par 'gyur ba ji ltar na rnam pa gzhan du yang 'chad pa mi srid pa nyid ces bya ba'i dogs pa de bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: How could it be impossible to explain it in some other way?

original: dgos pa dang de'i rgyu bshad pa'i sgo nas rgyu mtshan gnyis pa mi slu ba nyid /
analyzed: dgos pa dang de'i rgyu bshad pa'i sgo nas rgyu mtshan gnyis pa mi slu ba nyid /
translated: In order to dispel that doubt, the second reason, non-deceptiveness, is explained by way of stating the purpose and its cause.

original: sdug bsngal bsgral phyir zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bsgral phyir zhes pa la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The second reason is stated: “In order to liberate from suffering.”

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: gang gi phyir bskal pa du mar @178b sdug bsngal ba'i skye bo la dmigs pa'i snying rje 'bad par goms pa las gang zhig de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa na nye bar bstan pa la 'jug pa de gang gis na slu bar byed par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bskal pa du mar @178b sdug bsngal ba'i skye bo la dmigs pa'i snying rje 'bad par goms pa las gang zhig de'i bdag nyid du gyur pa na nye bar bstan pa la 'jug pa de gang gis na slu bar byed par 'gyur ba /
translated: Because of the cultivation of effort in compassion for beings who are suffering for many eons, when one becomes of their nature, one engages in teaching them. How could one be deceptive?

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal bsgral ba las gzhan pa'i dgos pa rtsed mo la sogs pa 'dod par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal bsgral ba las gzhan pa'i dgos pa rtsed mo la sogs pa 'dod par byed /
translated: How could one desire a purpose other than liberating from suffering, such as play and so on?

original: de'i phyir de'i bshad pa ni mi slu bar byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i bshad pa ni mi slu bar byed pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the explanation of that is only non-deceptive.

original: sgrub pa la ltos nas sdug bsngal mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir 'byung khung gi lnga pa sdug bsngal las zhes bstan par rigs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sgrub pa la ltos nas sdug bsngal mtshan nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir 'byung khung gi lnga pa sdug bsngal las zhes bstan par rigs pa ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not reasonable to teach the fifth case, from suffering, in order to understand suffering as the characteristic of the effect in relation to the practice?

original: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi zhes bstan /
analyzed: ji ltar na sdug bsngal gyi zhes bstan /
translated: Why is it taught as of suffering?

original: sdug bsngal ba'i skye bo ni sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya ba nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i skye bo ni sdug bsngal las bsgral bar bya ba nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: The suffering person is to be liberated from suffering, one might say.

original: skyon de dag med de /
analyzed: skyon de dag med de /
translated: Those faults do not exist.

original: sdug bsngal gyi mtshams dang / de dang ldan pa la 'brel pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi mtshams dang / de dang ldan pa la 'brel pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is possible to connect the boundary of suffering and that which possesses it.

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pas byed pa rnams 'jug pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pas byed pa rnams 'jug pa de'i phyir /
translated: Because those who act out of desire engage in it,

original: 'dis 'brel pa 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa'i drug pa 'thad pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'brel pa 'dod pa tsam la rag las pa'i drug pa 'thad pa kho na'o //
translated: therefore this sixth case, which depends merely on the desire for connection, is tenable.

original: yang na bsgral ba'i byed pa po ni sdug bsngal las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal ba'i bdag la sogs pa yang dag par med par bstan pa'i phyir de ltar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na bsgral ba'i byed pa po ni sdug bsngal las gzhan pa'i sdug bsngal ba'i bdag la sogs pa yang dag par med par bstan pa'i phyir de ltar bstan pa yin no //
translated: Or else, it is taught in that way in order to teach that the agent of liberation, other than suffering, does not truly exist, such as a self that suffers.

original: gang yang / bdag tu lta ba bdag nyid bdag mtshan min //
analyzed: gang yang / bdag tu lta ba bdag nyid bdag mtshan min //
translated: The view of self is not the self,

original: ngan par gnas men mtshan nyid mi 'dra'i phyir //
analyzed: ngan par gnas men mtshan nyid mi 'dra'i phyir //
translated: because it does not have the characteristics of self.

original: gnyis las gzhan med de ni nor pa skyes //
analyzed: gnyis las gzhan med de ni nor pa skyes //
translated: It is not different from the two, and it is produced by error.

original: de phyir thar pa nor pa zad tsam yin //
analyzed: de phyir thar pa nor pa zad tsam yin //
translated: Therefore, liberation is the exhaustion of error.

original: zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal bsgral phyir zhes bya ba 'dir /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal bsgral phyir zhes bya ba 'dir /
translated: Thus, in this passage, “in order to liberate from suffering”

original: 'khrul pa zad phyir zhes bya ba'i don du gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa zad phyir zhes bya ba'i don du gnas pa yin no //
translated: means “in order to exhaust error.”

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni kun rdzob tu de nyid mngon par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni kun rdzob tu de nyid mngon par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The word “suffering” expresses that conventional truth.

original: de ltar na thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na thams cad legs par gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, everything is well established.

original: 'di dag ni rtogs zin to //
analyzed: 'di dag ni rtogs zin to //
translated: This has been understood.

original: gal te rig bya rig pa dang / snying rje'i rang bzhin can sdug bsngal zad pa nyid kyi 'bras bu rnams gzhan dag la sbyin pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa la 'jug pa ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid dang mi slu bar byed pa la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rig bya rig pa dang / snying rje'i rang bzhin can sdug bsngal zad pa nyid kyi 'bras bu rnams gzhan dag la sbyin pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa la 'jug pa ni phyin ci ma log pa nyid dang mi slu bar byed pa la brten pa yin te /
translated: If one engages in teaching the object of knowledge, the knowledge, and the result of the extinction of suffering, which has the nature of compassion, for the sake of giving them to others, that is based on non-error and non-deception.

original: de'i phyir der da ltar thos pa dang ldan pa yin yang /
analyzed: de'i phyir der da ltar thos pa dang ldan pa yin yang /
translated: Therefore, even though one has learning right now,

original: de'i 'bras bu grub pa ji ltar na mthong ba yin /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu grub pa ji ltar na mthong ba yin /
translated: how can one see the accomplishment of its result?

original: de'i phyir bstod pa 'di 'ba' zhig nye bar mtshon pa yin no zhes /
analyzed: de'i phyir bstod pa 'di 'ba' zhig nye bar mtshon pa yin no zhes /
translated: Therefore, this praise alone is the illustration.

original: phyi ma'i dus su sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du de 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan @179a * //
analyzed: phyi ma'i dus su sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcad pa'i don du de 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan @179a * //
translated: In order to eliminate superimpositions in the future, the reason for engaging in that

original: gdul bya skal ba dang ldan pa nyid bstan pa'i don du /
analyzed: gdul bya skal ba dang ldan pa nyid bstan pa'i don du /
translated: is taught in order to show that the disciples are fortunate.

original: de yis 'gro ba'i sems can la //
analyzed: de yis 'gro ba'i sems can la //
translated: By that, for the sentient beings of the world,

original: zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: he says.

original: 'dir skal ba dang ldan pa nyid kyang de'i dang tshul can du sgrub pa'i rkyen gyis bsgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'dir skal ba dang ldan pa nyid kyang de'i dang tshul can du sgrub pa'i rkyen gyis bsgrub pa nyid do //
translated: Here, being fortunate is established by the condition of establishing it in that way.

original: de la brten nas nye bar bstan pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de la brten nas nye bar bstan pa 'bras bu dang bcas pa kho na ste /
translated: Based on that, the teaching is only together with its result.

original: de ltar na cung zad kyang chad pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na cung zad kyang chad pa med do //
translated: Thus, there is no nihilism at all.

original: gang phyir sprin las char 'bab kyang //
analyzed: gang phyir sprin las char 'bab kyang //
translated: Because even though rain falls from clouds,

original: sa bon min las mi 'byung ltar //
analyzed: sa bon min las mi 'byung ltar //
translated: it does not arise from non-seeds.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung na yang //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung na yang //
translated: Even when the buddhas appear,

original: skal pa med pas 'bras mi myong //
analyzed: skal pa med pas 'bras mi myong //
translated: those without good fortune do not experience the result.

original: zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is explained.

original: de ltar na rgyan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa nyid dang mi slu bar byed pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan nas //
analyzed: de ltar na rgyan nyid la phyin ci ma log pa nyid dang mi slu bar byed pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan bstan nas //
translated: Thus, having taught the reason for the very non-erroneousness and non-deceptiveness of the ornament itself,

original: gsum pa don ma lus pa nyid de ston par bzhed nas /
analyzed: gsum pa don ma lus pa nyid de ston par bzhed nas /
translated: third, wishing to teach the very completeness of the meaning,

original: 'byor ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'byor ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says “mastery,” and so on.

original: gsung rab la ni gang gi de ma bstan na /
analyzed: gsung rab la ni gang gi de ma bstan na /
translated: If that is not taught in the scriptures,

original: 'di'i don ma rdzogs par 'gyur ba /🔽don rnam pa lngas lhag pa'i shes bya srid pa'am /
analyzed: 'di'i don ma rdzogs par 'gyur ba / don rnam pa lngas lhag pa'i shes bya srid pa'am /
translated: the meaning of this will be incomplete.

original: nye bar bstan pa srid pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nye bar bstan pa srid pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: There is no possibility of any remaining object of knowledge or teaching with the five topics.

original: thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dag gis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all are included in the defilement and purification.

original: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang bsam par bya ba don gsum gyis bstan to //
analyzed: de la kun nas nyon mongs pa ni bsgrub par bya ba dang / bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang bsam par bya ba don gsum gyis bstan to //
translated: Among them, defilement is taught by three topics: that which is to be accomplished, that which is to be specifically known, and that which is to be reflected upon.

original: rnam par byang ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / yongs su grub pa gnyis kyis bstan to //
translated: Purification is taught by two topics: the inconceivable and the perfected.

original: de ston pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa ni 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: de ston pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa ni 'di nyid yin te /
translated: This very [perfection of wisdom] is the power to teach that.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs rab tu thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the attainment of meditative concentration and retention.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar na /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar na /
translated: Therefore, how is it that

original: gzhan gyis bshad pa rnams don ma lus par gsal bar byed pa'i 'bras bu can du 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bshad pa rnams don ma lus par gsal bar byed pa'i 'bras bu can du 'gyur /
translated: the explanations of others become fruitful by clarifying the entire meaning?

original: de lta bas na ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu rnams kyi nye bar bstan pa'i snyan bcos 'di mkhas pa rnams la khyad par gyi dga' ba bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyan nyid dang 'dra ba ni rigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu rnams kyi nye bar bstan pa'i snyan bcos 'di mkhas pa rnams la khyad par gyi dga' ba bskyed pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyan nyid dang 'dra ba ni rigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Therefore, this treatise, which is taught by the aforementioned causes, is an ornament similar to the very ornament of the wise, because it is the cause of generating special joy in the wise.

original: khyad par can gyi dga' ba'i rgyu de nyid kho na don rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi dga' ba'i rgyu de nyid kho na don rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: Just that cause of special joy, in terms of five aspects,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i chos bshad pa'i bstan bcos 'di la go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa'i chos bshad pa'i bstan bcos 'di la go rims bzhin du /
translated: in this treatise that explains the Dharma taught by the Blessed One, in order to establish it,

original: gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe lngas bsgrub pa'i don du /
analyzed: gser las brdungs byas 'dra zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i dpe lngas bsgrub pa'i don du /
translated: five examples are stated, beginning with like gold that is refined.

original: gser las brdungs byas 'dra @179b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gser las brdungs byas 'dra @179b zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Like gold that is refined and so on are stated.

original: de la don rnam pa lnga ji 'dra ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de la don rnam pa lnga ji 'dra ba yin zhe na /
translated: Therein, what are the five aspects of the meaning?

original: rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes zhes ba'o //
translated: They are the reason, the name, the conception, suchness, and right wisdom.

original: de la rgyu mtshan ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid ni 'di phan tshun rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa dang / nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dang / 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid ni 'di phan tshun rgyu nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason is that the reason for the store-consciousness, the defiled mind, and the actual consciousnesses is that they are the reciprocal cause of each other.

original: ming ni rgyu mtshan de nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin yang mig btsums byed pa bzhin du yang dag par mtshon par byed pa'i brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni rgyu mtshan de nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin yang mig btsums byed pa bzhin du yang dag par mtshon par byed pa'i brjod pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Name is the expression which, although not the reason itself, is like the closing of the eyes, and which correctly indicates the reason.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rang bzhin dang ; khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rang bzhin dang ; khyad par du rnam par rtog pa ste /
translated: Conceptual differentiation is the conceptual differentiation of the nature and the special qualities of the reason as it has been explained.

original: khams gsum pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
analyzed: khams gsum pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'o //
translated: It is the mind and mental activities associated with the three realms.

original: de bzhin nyid ni stong pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni stong pa nyid do //
translated: Suchness is emptiness.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes ni de bzhin nyid la dmigs pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i ye shes so //
translated: Correct direct intuition is the supramundane direct intuition that has suchness for its object.

original: de rnams kyi go rims ni 'di nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi go rims ni 'di nyid kho na yin te /
translated: Their order is just this.

original: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gdags pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir dang por rgyu mtshan no //
analyzed: 'di ltar kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gdags pa'i gzhi yin pa'i phyir dang por rgyu mtshan no //
translated: The third is the discrimination, because it discriminates the basis of defilement in accordance with the name.🔽The fourth is the view of the self, because it is the discrimination of the self and what pertains to the self on the part of the view of the self.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gdags pa nyid kyi phyir /🔽de ma thag tu ming ngo //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gdags pa nyid kyi phyir / de ma thag tu ming ngo //
translated: The fifth is the adherence to views, because it is the adherence to the view of the self and the extreme views.

original: ming ji lta ba bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhir rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: ming ji lta ba bzhin du kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gzhir rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ;
translated: The sixth is the adherence to mere rules and rituals, because it is the adherence to the view of the self and the extreme views.

original: de'i 'og tu rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: The seventh is envy, because it is the desire to surpass others.🔽The eighth is avarice, because it is the desire to possess.🔽The ninth is anger, because it is the desire to harm.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa de yang de bzhin nyid la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis 'gog pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa de yang de bzhin nyid la yang dag pa'i ye shes kyis 'gog pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The tenth is hypocrisy, because it is the concealment of one's own faults.🔽The eleventh is malice, because it is the desire to harm others.🔽The twelfth is envy, because it is the desire to surpass others.🔽The thirteenth is the view of individuality, because it is the adherence to the self and what pertains to the self.

original: de'i rjes la de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes la de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i ye shes yin no //
translated: The fourteenth is the adherence to extremes, because it is the adherence to the self as having an end or having no end.

original: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni rgyu mtshan la bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya bar bstan te /🔽gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'grel pa mdzad pas ni rgyu mtshan la bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya bar bstan te / gzhan gyi dbang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rgyu dang rkyen las nges par 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The fifteenth is wrong view, because it is the denial of cause, effect and the noble ones.🔽The sixteenth is esteeming of (such things as) morality and asceticism, because it is the adherence to a view as being the highest.🔽The seventeenth is doubt, because it is the state of being divided with regard to the three jewels.🔽The eighteenth is the proclivity for passion, because it is the desire for sexual union.🔽The nineteenth is the proclivity for resistance, because it is the desire to harm others.

original: gser las brdungs byas 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gser las brdungs byas 'dra ba'o //
translated: The twentieth is the proclivity for conceit, because it is the desire to be superior to others.🔽The twenty-first is the proclivity for ignorance, because it is the desire for non-perception.🔽The twenty-second is the proclivity for views, because it is the desire for the extreme views.🔽The twenty-third is the proclivity for adherence, because it is the desire for the adherence to views and morality and asceticism.🔽The twenty-fourth is the proclivity for perplexity, because

original: gang gi phyir gser ni gdu bu dang / rna rgyan dang / dpung rgyan la sogs pa nyid du rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gser ni gdu bu dang / rna rgyan dang / dpung rgyan la sogs pa nyid du rang bzhin gyis grub pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Because gold is not essentially established as an entity that is a bracelet, earring, necklace, or anklet, etc.

original: bsreg pa dang bcad pa dang chus bran pa dang / brdung ba la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams don med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsreg pa dang bcad pa dang chus bran pa dang / brdung ba la sogs pa'i rkyen rnams don med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it follows that the conditions of burning, cutting, sprinkling with water, beating, etc. would be pointless.

original: ming ni bye brag tu shes par bya ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ming ni bye brag tu shes par bya ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: A name is that which causes one to understand a particular thing.

original: gang gi phyir ming ni mar me bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis don shes par byed pa ni ma yin te /🔽brda rig pa bzhin du brda ma rig pas kyang @180a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ming ni mar me bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis don shes par byed pa ni ma yin te / brda rig pa bzhin du brda ma rig pas kyang @180a * //
translated: Because a name does not cause one to understand an object by means of suitability, like a lamp,

original: don rtogs pa skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don rtogs pa skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it follows that one would understand an object even if one did not know the convention, like one who knows the convention.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /🔽'di ni 'di'i brjod bya /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na / 'di ni 'di'i brjod bya /
translated: Well, then, what is it?

original: 'di ni 'di'i rjod par byed pa zhes skyes bu'i 'dod pas brtags pa'i brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel ba shes pas so //
analyzed: 'di ni 'di'i rjod par byed pa zhes skyes bu'i 'dod pas brtags pa'i brjod bya rjod byed kyi 'brel ba shes pas so //
translated: It is the connection between the expressed and the expresser that is imputed by the desire of a person, thinking, “This is the expressed, this is the expresser.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir ming ji lta ba'i don ni mi srid pa'i phyir don gyi dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ming ji lta ba'i don ni mi srid pa'i phyir don gyi dbang du byas nas /
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of the name is impossible, the name is made in consideration of the object.

original: 'di kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi khongs su 'dus par gzhan gyis brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyi khongs su 'dus par gzhan gyis brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, since the meaning of the name is impossible, others have said that this is included in the imagined nature, from the perspective of the object.

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: But not from the perspective of its own nature,

original: rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de ni brtags pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de ni brtags pa nyid ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of consciousness itself, and that is not imagined.

original: shes pa de nyid kyang bye brag tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa de nyid kyang bye brag tu shes pa ste /
translated: That consciousness itself is also a particular consciousness,

original: de yang brda shes pa bye brag tu shes pa po la ltos nas /
analyzed: de yang brda shes pa bye brag tu shes pa po la ltos nas /
translated: and that is a particular consciousness that knows signs, in dependence on the one who knows signs.

original: gzhan la 'gyur ba de'i phyir bye brag tu shes par bya zhes bstan te padma rgyas pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan la 'gyur ba de'i phyir bye brag tu shes par bya zhes bstan te padma rgyas pa bzhin no //
translated: Since it is different from the other, it is taught to be a particular consciousness, like a blooming lotus.

original: gang gi phyir padma ni 'byed par byed pa skyes bu'i lag pa dang / nyi ma 'od zer dang / yongs su 'brel pa la ltos pa med par rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyis bye brag tu shes par bya ba'i yul du thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir padma ni 'byed par byed pa skyes bu'i lag pa dang / nyi ma 'od zer dang / yongs su 'brel pa la ltos pa med par rnam par dbye ba'i mtshan nyid can gyis bye brag tu shes par bya ba'i yul du thob pa ma yin no //
translated: Because a lotus is not an object that is to be known by the characteristic of being opened, without relying on the hand of a person who opens it, or the sun and its rays.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni bsam par bya ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni bsam par bya ba zhes bya ste /
translated: Imagination is called the object of thought.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams la 'jug par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to enter into the unconditioned realm,

original: dam pa'i chos thos spa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos thos spa las byung ba'i tshul bzhin yid la byed pas /
translated: through proper mental attention that arises from listening to the sublime Dharma,

original: de ni gdon mi za bar bsam par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gdon mi za bar bsam par bya ba nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is undoubtedly the object of thought.

original: rnam par rtog pa spangs pa med par ni 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings la 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa spangs pa med par ni 'dus ma byas kyi dbyings la 'jug par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: Without abandoning imagination, one does not enter into the unconditioned realm.

original: rnam par rtog pa yang thog ma med pa ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis brdzun pa yin yang rgyu mtshan la rang bzhin dang khyad par dag gi ming ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa nyid du mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa ni bdag nyid nye
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang thog ma med pa ma rig pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis brdzun pa yin yang rgyu mtshan la rang bzhin dang khyad par dag gi ming ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa nyid du mngon par zhen pas 'jug pa ni bdag nyid nye
translated: Conceptualization, although false due to the power of beginningless ignorance, engages in the nature and attributes of reasons as if they were real, by the adherence to their reality.

original: bar zhi ba'i thabs rig pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par dpyod pa med par spong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bar zhi ba'i thabs rig pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i rnam par dpyod pa med par spong ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is abandoned without the knowledge of the means of pacifying the self and without the subsequent analysis.

original: ji skad du rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis dag gis yang dag par mthong ba skye ste /
analyzed: ji skad du rgyu gnyis dang rkyen gnyis dag gis yang dag par mthong ba skye ste /
translated: As it is said, “The correct view arises from two causes and two conditions.

original: pha rol gyis bstan pa dang bdag nyid la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: pha rol gyis bstan pa dang bdag nyid la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: The teaching of others and the proper mental attention to oneself.”

original: de ma spangs na yang kun nas nyon mongs pa kho na mngon du byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ma spangs na yang kun nas nyon mongs pa kho na mngon du byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is not abandoned, then only the afflictions will be manifested.

original: rnam par byang ba'i bde ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / rnam par byang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par byang ba'i bde ba ni ma yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa spangs pa dang / rnam par byang ba thob par bya ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni /
translated: because it is not the happiness of purification.

original: ming ji lta ba ni yul @180b med pa nyid du bsam par bya ba ste /
analyzed: ming ji lta ba ni yul @180b med pa nyid du bsam par bya ba ste /
translated: The name should be considered as having no object, just as it is.

original: kha zas g-yos legs bzhin no //
analyzed: kha zas g-yos legs bzhin no //
translated: Like a well-cooked meal.

original: gang gi phyir kha zas legs par rang bzhin dang / khyad par dag tu ma bsams par g-yos legs pa'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir kha zas legs par rang bzhin dang / khyad par dag tu ma bsams par g-yos legs pa'am /
translated: Because a well-cooked meal is not considered as having a nature and a particular,

original: de nye bar longs spyad pa'i bde ba la chags pa'i yid can gyi bde ba sgrub par gyur pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: de nye bar longs spyad pa'i bde ba la chags pa'i yid can gyi bde ba sgrub par gyur pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: or as having the happiness of enjoying it, or as having the happiness that is achieved by one whose mind is attached to the happiness of enjoying it.

original: / des na de yang bsam par bya ba yin zhes grags pa'i phyir 'dir dper gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: / des na de yang bsam par bya ba yin zhes grags pa'i phyir 'dir dper gyur pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is well known that it also should be considered, and so it is an example here.

original: de'i phyir de ltar gsung rab las bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa'i don gsum ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar gsung rab las bstan pa'i rgyu mtshan dang / ming dang / rnam par rtog pa'i don gsum ni /
translated: Thus, the three topics of the reason, the name, and the meaning of the concept taught in the scriptures

original: dpe gsum gyis bsgrub bya dang / bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas chos bstan par 'jug pas ji ston par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dpe gsum gyis bsgrub bya dang / bye brag tu shes par bya ba dang / bsam par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i dbang du byas nas chos bstan par 'jug pas ji ston par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is undertaken in terms of the three examples, in order to demonstrate the probandum, the particular, and the object of reflection.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de'i tha snyad do //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / de'i tha snyad do //
translated: The cause of the defilement and its verbal expression.

original: de la rgyu mtshan ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rgyu mtshan ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: The cause is the defilement.

original: ming dang rnam par rtog pa dag ni de'i tha snyad yin te /
analyzed: ming dang rnam par rtog pa dag ni de'i tha snyad yin te /
translated: The name and the conceptual differentiation are its verbal expression,

original: de dag gis de nyid rang bzhin dang / khyad par du tha snyad du btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis de nyid rang bzhin dang / khyad par du tha snyad du btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because by means of them, it is designated as the intrinsic nature and the particular.

original: de tsam kho na 'khor ba yin te /
analyzed: de tsam kho na 'khor ba yin te /
translated: Only that is samsara,

original: 'di tha snyad du bya ba dang / tha snyad dag las lhag par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di tha snyad du bya ba dang / tha snyad dag las lhag par 'gyur ba rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not logical that there should be anything higher than the verbal expression and the name.

original: de la sgrub par byed pa zhes bya bar brjod pa dang 'brel bas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa mtshan nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu med pa can du rtog pa bsal bar mdzad pa yin te rang gi ngo bo sgrub pa'i
analyzed: de la sgrub par byed pa zhes bya bar brjod pa dang 'brel bas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun du rtog pa mtshan nyid kyis kun nas nyon mongs pa rgyu med pa can du rtog pa bsal bar mdzad pa yin te rang gi ngo bo sgrub pa'i
translated: The term “establishment” is connected to the term “agent,” and thus the root text states that the characteristic of the unreal imagination is “unfounded.”

original: phyir / gzhan la ltos pa kho na de ltar bsnyad pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir / gzhan la ltos pa kho na de ltar bsnyad pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the object that is referred to by the term “agent” is only something that is dependent on something else.

original: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu can du rtog pa bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan zhes bya ba ni mi mthun pa'i rgyu can du rtog pa bsal ba yin te /
translated: The term “reason” is used to eliminate the notion that the reason for the existence of the unreal imagination is something that is incompatible with it.

original: gang gi phyir de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du srid pa yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de las gzhan pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid du srid pa yin na /
translated: This is because it is possible that the reason for the existence of the unreal imagination is something other than that.

original: rgyun la brten nas phan tshun rgyu nyid du bsams nas de nyid rgyu mtshan nyid mngon par brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun la brten nas phan tshun rgyu nyid du bsams nas de nyid rgyu mtshan nyid mngon par brjod par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to state that the reason for the existence of the unreal imagination is the continuum itself, since the unreal imagination is considered to be the mutual cause of the continuum.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin med pa nyid du yongs su bstan pas 'di snying rje can la brdzun pa nyid kyis mi skrag pa'i yul du yang bstan pa yin no //🔽gang yang / rang dang rang gi bdag nyid du //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rang bzhin med pa nyid du yongs su bstan pas 'di snying rje can la brdzun pa nyid kyis mi skrag pa'i yul du yang bstan pa yin no // gang yang / rang dang rang gi bdag nyid du //
translated: Therefore, since it is taught that it is essenceless, it is also taught that it is an object that does not frighten the compassionate one with its falsity.🔽And also:

original: med phyir rang gi ngo bo la //🔽mi gnas phyir dang 'dzin bzhin du //
analyzed: med phyir rang gi ngo bo la // mi gnas phyir dang 'dzin bzhin du //
translated: Because it does not exist in itself and in its own nature,🔽Because it does not endure in its own nature,

original: med phyir ngo bo nyid med 'dod //
analyzed: med phyir ngo bo nyid med 'dod //
translated: And because it does not exist as it is apprehended,🔽It is asserted that it is essenceless.

original: phyi ma phyi ma'i rten yin pas //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma'i rten yin pas //
translated: Because it is the basis of the latter,

original: ngo bo nyid med med pa yi //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid med med pa yi //
translated: The essencelessness of that which does not exist,

original: skye med 'gag med gzod nas zhi //
analyzed: skye med 'gag med gzod nas zhi //
translated: Is established as non-arising, non-ceasing, primordially peaceful,

original: rang bzhin mya ngan 'das @181a * //🔽pa 'grub // ces ston par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: rang bzhin mya ngan 'das @181a * // pa 'grub // ces ston par 'gyur ro /
translated: And essentially in a state of nirvana.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa yang dag par rang bzhin med pa yin yang /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yang dag pa ma yin pa'i kun tu rtog pa yang dag par rang bzhin med pa yin yang /
translated: Therefore, although the imagination of what is unreal is essentially essenceless,

original: byis pa'i skye bo rang bzhin nyid kyis zhen pa de'i zhen pa nyid bsal ba'i don du /
analyzed: byis pa'i skye bo rang bzhin nyid kyis zhen pa de'i zhen pa nyid bsal ba'i don du /
translated: in order to remove the attachment of childish beings who are attached to it by nature,

original: 'di thams cad ni ming tsam ste /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni ming tsam ste /
translated: it is said that all of this is mere name.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: mig dang gzugs nas yid dang chos kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mig dang gzugs nas yid dang chos kyi bar du'o //
translated: from eye and form up to mind and mental objects.

original: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
analyzed: ming ni gang dang gang dag gis //
translated: Whatever names there are

original: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
analyzed: chos ni gang dang gang brjod pa //
translated: for whatever things there are,

original: de la de ni yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la de ni yod ma yin //
translated: those things do not exist in those names.

original: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
analyzed: de ni chos rnams chos nyid do //
translated: That is the reality of things.

original: ming nyid ming gis stong pa ste //
analyzed: ming nyid ming gis stong pa ste //
translated: Name itself is empty of name;

original: ming min la ni ming yod min //
analyzed: ming min la ni ming yod min //
translated: there is no name in the absence of name.

original: chos kun ming dang bral ba ste //
analyzed: chos kun ming dang bral ba ste //
translated: All things are free from name;

original: ming ni kun du brtags pa yin //
analyzed: ming ni kun du brtags pa yin //
translated: name is a conceptual imputation.

original: zhes bya ba'i phyogs la ming gi bdag nyid kyis tha snyad bye brag tu shes par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir brdzun pa'i yul can du bstan pa yin no //🔽gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis don dang ldan nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i phyogs la ming gi bdag nyid kyis tha snyad bye brag tu shes par bya ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir brdzun pa'i yul can du bstan pa yin no // gang gi phyir rang bzhin gyis don dang ldan nam /
translated: In this context, in order to demonstrate that the object of a name is a particular that is known by means of verbal designation, it is shown to be a false object.

original: de dang 'brel pa la yang dag par srid na /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa la yang dag par srid na /
translated: If it were possible for a name to have an object by nature or by relation,

original: rjod byed yul med pa can du bstan par rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rjod byed yul med pa can du bstan par rigs pa dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: it would not be reasonable to demonstrate that the object of a name is nonexistent.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis tha snyad kyi ming ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid kyis tha snyad kyi ming ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa'i yul tha mi dad pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the objects that are engaged in accordance with conventional terms by the nature of conceptuality are not different,

original: yul med pa nyid du rtogs pa na kun nas nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: yul med pa nyid du rtogs pa na kun nas nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: when one realizes that there are no objects, in order to pacify the afflictions,

original: ji ltar zhen pa'i yul gyi de nyid bsam pa'i sgo nas bsal bar bya ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji ltar zhen pa'i yul gyi de nyid bsam pa'i sgo nas bsal bar bya ba nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate the elimination of the reality of the object of conception,

original: bsam par bya ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsam par bya ba nyid bstan pa yin no //
translated: the object of conception is taught.

original: 'dir rang gi ngo bo rnam par dpyad pas sel ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir rang gi ngo bo rnam par dpyad pas sel ba ni ma yin te /
translated: Here, it is not eliminated through the analysis of its nature.

original: de yang rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid las /
analyzed: de yang rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid las /
translated: Moreover, since that is not reversed from the nature of conceptuality,

original: ma log pas rnam par dpyod pa gzhan la ltos pa yin la /
analyzed: ma log pas rnam par dpyod pa gzhan la ltos pa yin la /
translated: analysis depends on another.

original: de yang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gzhan la ltos pa yin na /🔽thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de yang de'i ngo bo nyid yin pas gzhan la ltos pa yin na / thug pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: If that also depends on another due to being its nature,🔽there would be an infinite regress.

original: nam yang de yod pa mi srid pas grol ba med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nam yang de yod pa mi srid pas grol ba med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Since it would never be possible for it to exist, it follows that there would be no liberation.

original: de spangs pa kho na nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i bdag nyid can gyis grol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de spangs pa kho na nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi ba'i bdag nyid can gyis grol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because only the abandonment of that is liberation, which has the nature of the complete pacification of the afflictions.

original: sems dpa' mchog rnams ni rnam par rtog pa nyid kun nas nyon mongs par khas len pa yin no //
analyzed: sems dpa' mchog rnams ni rnam par rtog pa nyid kun nas nyon mongs par khas len pa yin no //
translated: The supreme beings accept that conceptualization itself is the afflictions.🔽And that is taught:

original: de yang / gang tshe rnam par dpyod pa yi //
analyzed: de yang / gang tshe rnam par dpyod pa yi //
translated: When analysis

original: rnam par dpyod pas dpyad byas pa //
analyzed: rnam par dpyod pas dpyad byas pa //
translated: is analyzed by analysis,
